member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window
member.summary: Provides an interface to expose Win32 HWND handles.
member.remarks:
This interface is implemented on objects that expose Win32 HWND handles. The resultant handle can be used with Win32 API calls.
Unlike the desktop .NET Framework this interface is not implemented in the base class. However you can implement it on any class which derives from or . The property can then be passed to native API functions such as those contained in the class.

example.code:
[VB] Imports OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms Imports OpenNETCF.Win32
Public Class MyControl Inherits System.Windows.Forms.Control Implements IWin32Window
Overridable ReadOnly Property Handle() As System.IntPtr Get Me.Capture = True Dim thishandle As IntPtr thishandle = Win32Window.GetCapture() Me.Capture = False
Handle = thishandle End Get End Property
End Class

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.BatteryMonitor.PrimaryBatteryLifeNotification
member.summary: Occurs when the primary battery life percentage is equal to the value of the PrimaryBatteryLifeTrigger property.
member.remarks: The Enabled property will be set to false when this event is raised. This prevents event handlers from being called multiple times while the trigger is satisfied. To receive further power notifications the Enabled property must once again be set to true.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.Clipboard2
member.summary: Provides methods to place data on and retrieve data from the system clipboard.
member.remarks:
For a list of predefined formats to use with the Clipboard class, see the class.
Call to put data on the clipboard.
Place data on the clipboard in multiple formats to maximize the possibility that a target application, whose format requirements you might not know, can successfully retrieve the data.
Call to retrieve data from the clipboard. The data is returned as an object that implements the interface. Use the methods specified by and fields in to extract the data from the object. If you do not know the format of the data you retrieved, call the method of the interface to get a list of all formats that data is stored in. Then call the method of the interface, and specify a format that your application can use.
All Windows applications share the system clipboard, so the contents are subject to change when you switch to another application.. Supports only Unicode text and Image (Bitmap) formats.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog
member.summary: Represents a common dialog box that displays available colors along with controls that allow the user to define custom colors.
member.remarks:
The method must be invoked to create this specific common dialog box. Use to retrieve the color selected by the user.
When you create an instance of ColorDialog, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the ColorDialog constructor.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorDialog class.
member.remarks:
When you create an instance of ColorDialog, the following read/write properties are set to initial values. PropertyInitial Value
AllowFullOpentrue
ColorColor.Black
CustomColorsA null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)
FullOpenfalse
You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.AllowFullOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can use the dialog box to define custom colors.
member.value: true if the user can define custom colors; otherwise, false. The default is true
member.remarks: When set to false, the associated button in the dialog box is disabled and the user cannot access the custom colors control in the dialog box. Windows CE supports the button, Pocket PC does not and this property has no effect.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.AnyColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays all available colors in the set of basic colors.
member.value: true if the dialog box displays all available colors in the set of basic colors; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color selected by the user.
member.value: The color selected by the user. If a color is not selected, the default value is black.
member.remarks: The color selected by the user in the dialog box at run time, as defined in structure

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.CustomColors
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of custom colors shown in the dialog box.
member.value: A set of custom colors shown by the dialog box. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: Users can create their own set of custom colors. These colors are contained in an Int32 composed of the ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values necessary to create the color. For more information on the structure of this data, see . Custom colors can only be defined if is set to true (Not supported on Pocket PC).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.FullOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the controls used to create custom colors are visible when the dialog box is opened.
member.value: true if the custom color controls are available when the dialog box is opened; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
By default, the custom color controls are not visible when the dialog box is first opened. You must click the Custom Colors button to display them.
Note: If is false, then FullOpen has no effect.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.SolidColorOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box will restrict users to selecting solid colors only.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IMessageFilter
member.summary: Defines a message filter interface.
member.remarks:
This interface allows an application to capture a message before it is dispatched to a control or form.
A class that implements the IMessageFilter interface can be added to the application's message pump to filter out a message or perform other operations before the message is dispatched to a form or control. To add the message filter to an application's message pump, use the method in the class.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage(Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.
member.returns: true to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; false to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon
member.summary: Specifies a component that creates an icon in the status area
member.remarks: Icons in the status area are short cuts to processes that are running in the background of a computer, such as a virus protection program or a volume control. These processes do not come with their own user interfaces. The class provides a way to program in this functionality. The Icon property defines the icon that appears in the status area. Pop-up menus for an icon are addressed with the ContextMenu property. The property assigns ToolTip text (Tooltips are not supported by the Pocket PC interface). In order for the icon to show up in the status area, the property must be set to true.

member.remarks: The Pocket PC interface does not display tooptips.
member.value: The ToolTip text displayed when the mouse hovers over a status area icon.
member.exception: ToolTip text must be less than 64 characters long.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the icon is visible in the status notification area of the taskbar.
member.value: true if the icon is visible in the status area; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Since the default value is false, in order for the icon to show up in the status area, you must set the Visible property to true.

member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar2.PerformStep
member.summary: Advances the current position of the progress bar by the amount of the Step property.
member.remarks: The PerformStep method increments the value of the progress bar by the amount specified by the Step property. You can use the Step property to specify the amount that each completed task in an operation changes the value of the progress bar. For example, if you are copying a group of files, you might want to set the value of the Step property to 1 and the value of the Maximum property to the total number of files to copy. When each file is copied, you can call the PerformStep method to increment the progress bar by the value of the Step property. If you want to have more flexible control of the value of the progress bar, you can use the Increment method or set the value of the Value property directly. The Value property specifies the current position of the ProgressBar. If, after calling the PerformStep method, the Value property is greater than the value of the Maximum property, the Value property remains at the value of the Maximum property. If, after calling the PerformStep method with a negative value specified in the value parameter, the Value property is less than the value of the Value property, the Value property remains at the value of the Minimum property.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar2.Increment(System.Int32)
member.summary: Advances the current position of the progress bar by the specified amount.
member.remarks: The Increment method enables you to increment the value of the progress bar by a specific amount. This method of incrementing the progress bar is similar to using the Step property with the PerformStep method. The Value property specifies the current position of the ProgressBar. If, after calling the Increment method, the Value property is greater than the value of the Maximum property, the Value property remains at the value of the Maximum property. If, after calling the Increment method with a negative value specified in the value parameter, the Value property is less than the value of the Minimum property, the Value property remains at the value of the Minimum property.
member.param: The amount by which to increment the progress bar's current position.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SendKeys
member.summary: Provides methods for sending keystrokes to an application.
member.remarks:
A quote from "http://msdn2.microsoft.com/library/k3w7761b.aspx": Each key is represented by one or more characters. To specify a single keyboard character, use the character itself. For example, to represent the letter A, pass in the string "A" to the method. To represent more than one character, append each additional character to the one preceding it. To represent the letters A, B, and C, specify the parameter as "ABC".
The plus sign (+), caret (^), percent sign (%), tilde (~), and parentheses () have special meanings to SendKeys. To specify one of these characters, enclose it within braces ({}). For example, to specify the plus sign, use "{+}". To specify brace characters, use "{{}" and "{}}". Brackets ([ ]) have no special meaning to SendKeys, but you must enclose them in braces.
To specify that any combination of SHIFT (+), CTRL (^), and ALT (%) should be held down while several other keys are pressed, enclose the code for those keys in parentheses. For example, to specify to hold down SHIFT while E and C are pressed, use "+(EC)". To specify to hold down SHIFT while E is pressed, followed by C without SHIFT, use "+EC".
To specify repeating keys, use the form {key number}. You must put a space between key and number. For example, {LEFT 42} means press the LEFT ARROW key 42 times; {h 10} means press H 10 times.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SendKeys.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Sends keystrokes to the active application.
member.param: The string of keystrokes to send.

member.summary: An application sends a CB_ADDSTRING message to add a string to the list box of a combo box. If the combo box does not have the CBS_SORT style, the string is added to the end of the list. Otherwise, the string is inserted into the list, and the list is sorted

member.summary: An application sends a CB_INSERTSTRING message to insert a string into the list box of a combo box. Unlike the CB_ADDSTRING message, the CB_INSERTSTRING message does not cause a list with the CBS_SORT style to be sorted

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.SELECTSTRING
member.summary: An application sends a CB_SELECTSTRING message to search the list of a combo box for an item that begins with the characters in a specified string. If a matching item is found, it is selected and copied to the edit control.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.SETCURSEL
member.summary: An application sends a CB_SETCURSEL message to select a string in the list of a combo box. If necessary, the list scrolls the string into view. The text in the edit control of the combo box changes to reflect the new selection, and any previous selection in the list is removed

member.summary: An application sends a CB_SETLOCALE message to set the current locale of the combo box. If the combo box has the CBS_SORT style and strings are added using CB_ADDSTRING, the locale of a combo box affects how list items are sorted.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.GETLOCALE
member.summary: An application sends a CB_GETLOCALE message to retrieve the current locale of the combo box. The locale is used to determine the correct sorting order of displayed text for combo boxes with the CBS_SORT style and text added by using the CB_ADDSTRING message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.GETTOPINDEX
member.summary: An application sends the CB_GETTOPINDEX message to retrieve the zero-based index of the first visible item in the list box portion of a combo box. Initially, the item with index 0 is at the top of the list box, but if the list box contents have been scrolled, another item may be at the top.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.SETTOPINDEX
member.summary: An application sends the CB_SETTOPINDEX message to ensure that a particular item is visible in the list box of a combo box. The system scrolls the list box contents so that either the specified item appears at the top of the list box or the maximum scroll range has been reached.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.GETHORIZONTALEXTENT
member.summary: An application sends the CB_GETHORIZONTALEXTENT message to retrieve from a combo box the width, in pixels, by which the list box can be scrolled horizontally (the scrollable width). This is applicable only if the list box has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.SETHORIZONTALEXTENT
member.summary: An application sends the CB_SETHORIZONTALEXTENT message to set the width, in pixels, by which a list box can be scrolled horizontally (the scrollable width). If the width of the list box is smaller than this value, the horizontal scroll bar horizontally scrolls items in the list box. If the width of the list box is equal to or greater than this value, the horizontal scroll bar is hidden or, if the combo box has the CBS_DISABLENOSCROLL style, disabled.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.GETDROPPEDWIDTH
member.summary: An application sends the CB_GETDROPPEDWIDTH message to retrieve the minimum allowable width, in pixels, of the list box of a combo box with the CBS_DROPDOWN or CBS_DROPDOWNLIST style

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.SETDROPPEDWIDTH
member.summary: An application sends the CB_SETDROPPEDWIDTH message to set the maximum allowable width, in pixels, of the list box of a combo box with the CBS_DROPDOWN or CBS_DROPDOWNLIST style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CB.INITSTORAGE
member.summary: An application sends the CB_INITSTORAGE message before adding a large number of items to the list box portion of a combo box. This message allocates memory for storing list box items.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS
member.summary: Combobox control styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.DROPDOWN
member.summary: Similar to CBS_SIMPLE, except that the list box is not displayed unless the user selects an icon next to the edit control.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.DROPDOWNLIST
member.summary: Similar to CBS_DROPDOWN, except that the edit control is replaced by a static text item that displays the current selection in the list box

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.AUTOHSCROLL
member.summary: Automatically scrolls the text in an edit control to the right when the user types a character at the end of the line. If this style is not set, only text that fits within the rectangular boundary is allowed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.OEMCONVERT
member.summary: character set and then back to the Windows character set. This ensures proper character conversion when the application calls the CharToOem function to convert a Windows string in the combo box to OEM characters. This style is most useful for combo boxes that contain file names and applies only to combo boxes created with the CBS_SIMPLE or CBS_DROPDOWN style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.SORT
member.summary: Automatically sorts strings added to the list box

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.HASSTRINGS
member.summary: Specifies that an owner-drawn combo box contains items consisting of strings. The combo box maintains the memory and address for the strings so the application can use the CB_GETLBTEXT message to retrieve the text for a particular item.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.NOINTEGRALHEIGHT
member.summary: Specifies that the size of the combo box is exactly the size specified by the application when it created the combo box. Normally, the system sizes a combo box so that it does not display partial items

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.DISABLENOSCROLL
member.summary: Shows a disabled vertical scroll bar in the list box when the box does not contain enough items to scroll. Without this style, the scroll bar is hidden when the list box does not contain enough items.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.UPPERCASE
member.summary: Converts to uppercase all text in both the selection field and the list.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.CBS.LOWERCASE
member.summary: Converts to lowercase all text in both the selection field and the list.

member.summary: Left aligned

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.CENTER
member.summary: Center aligned

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.RIGHT
member.summary: Right aligned

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.MULTILINE
member.summary: Designates a multiline edit control. The default is single-line edit control. When the multiline edit control is in a dialog box, the default response to pressing the ENTER key is to activate the default button. To use the ENTER key as a carriage return, use the ES_WANTRETURN style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.UPPERCASE
member.summary: Force uppercase

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.LOWERCASE
member.summary: Force lowercase

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.PASSWORD
member.summary: Displays an asterisk (*) for each character typed into the edit control. This style is valid only for single-line edit controls

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.AUTOVSCROLL
member.summary: Show vertical scrollbars automatically

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.AUTOHSCROLL
member.summary: Show horizontal scrollbars automatically

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.NOHIDESEL
member.summary: Negates the default behavior for an edit control. The default behavior hides the selection when the control loses the input focus and inverts the selection when the control receives the input focus. If you specify ES_NOHIDESEL, the selected text is inverted, even if the control does not have the focus.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.COMBOBOX
member.summary: Combobox

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.OEMCONVERT
member.summary: Converts text entered in the edit control. The text is converted from the Windows character set to the OEM character set and then back to the Windows character set. This ensures proper character conversion when the application calls the CharToOem function to convert a Windows string in the edit control to OEM characters. This style is most useful for edit controls that contain file names that will be used on file systems that do not support Unicode.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.READONLY
member.summary: Prevents the user from typing or editing text in the edit control

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.WANTRETURN
member.summary: Specifies that a carriage return be inserted when the user presses the ENTER key while entering text into a multiline edit control in a dialog box. If you do not specify this style, pressing the ENTER key has the same effect as pressing the dialog box's default push button. This style has no effect on a single-line edit control.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.ES.NUMBER
member.summary: Allows only digits to be entered into the edit control. Note that, even with this set, it is still possible to paste non-digits into the edit control.

member.summary: GetDateTimeRange.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS
member.summary: Listbox control styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.NOTIFY
member.summary: Parent window receives an input message whenever the user clicks or double-clicks a string

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.SORT
member.summary: Strings in the list box are sorted alphabetically.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.NOREDRAW
member.summary: List-box display is not updated when changes are made. This style can be changed at any time by sending a WM_SETREDRAW message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.MULTIPLESEL
member.summary: String selection is toggled each time the user clicks or double-clicks the string. Any number of strings can be selected.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.HASSTRINGS
member.summary: Specifies an owner-draw list box that contains items consisting of strings. The list box maintains the memory and pointers for the strings so the application can use the GetText member function to retrieve the text for a particular item.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.USETABSTOPS
member.summary: Allows a list box to recognize and expand tab characters when drawing its strings. The default tab positions are 32 dialog units. (A dialog unit is a horizontal or vertical distance. One horizontal dialog unit is equal to one-fourth of the current dialog base width unit. The dialog base units are computed based on the height and width of the current system font. The GetDialogBaseUnits Windows function returns the current dialog base units in pixels.) This style should not be used with LBS_OWNERDRAWFIXED.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.NOINTEGRALHEIGHT
member.summary: The size of the list box is exactly the size specified by the application when it created the list box. Usually, Windows sizes a list box so that the list box does not display partial items.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.MULTICOLUMN
member.summary: Specifies a multicolumn list box that is scrolled horizontally. The SetColumnWidth member function sets the width of the columns.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.WANTKEYBOARDINPUT
member.summary: The owner of the list box receives WM_VKEYTOITEM or WM_CHARTOITEM messages whenever the user presses a key while the list box has input focus. This allows an application to perform special processing on the keyboard input.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.EXTENDEDSEL
member.summary: The user can select multiple items using the SHIFT key and the mouse or special key combinations.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.DISABLENOSCROLL
member.summary: The list box shows a disabled vertical scroll bar when the list box does not contain enough items to scroll. Without this style, the scroll bar is hidden when the list box does not contain enough items.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.NODATA
member.summary: Specifies a no-data list box. Specify this style when the count of items in the list box will exceed one thousand. A no-data list box must also have the LBS_OWNERDRAWFIXED style, but must not have the LBS_SORT or LBS_HASSTRINGS style. A no-data list box resembles an owner-drawn list box except that it contains no string or bitmap data for an item. Commands to add, insert, or delete an item always ignore any given item data; requests to find a string within the list box always fail. The system sends the WM_DRAWITEM message to the owner window when an item must be drawn. The itemID member of the DRAWITEMSTRUCT structure passed with the WM_DRAWITEM message specifies the line number of the item to be drawn. A no-data list box does not send a WM_DELETEITEM message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.LBS.STANDARD
member.summary: Strings in the list box are sorted alphabetically, and the parent window receives an input message whenever the user clicks or double-clicks a string. The list box contains borders on all sides.

member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SW.RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP
member.summary: Flags used with SetWindowPos.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains current size (ignores the cx and cy members).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains current position (ignores the x and y members).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains current ordering (ignores the hwndInsertAfter member).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z-order.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the class description for the window) around the window. The window receives a WM_NCCALCSIZE message

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.SWP.NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as SWP_NOOWNERZORDER

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS
member.summary: Window style flags.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the BORDER style).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. This style cannot be used with the POPUP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Maximize button. Cannot be combined with the EX_CONTEXTHELP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Minimize button. Cannot be combined with the EX_CONTEXTHELP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the TILED style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the CHILD style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Close (X) button in the non-client area.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.summary: Extended control styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style cannot be activated. If a child window has this style, tapping it does not cause its top-level parent to be activated. A window that has this style receives stylus events, but neither it nor its child windows can get the focus. Supported in Windows CE versions 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the CLIENTEDGE and WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.CAPTIONOKBUTTON
member.summary: Window includes an OK button in the title bar

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NODRAG
member.summary: A window created with this style cannot be dragged using a mouse or stylus

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.ABOVESTARTUP
member.summary: Places window above Start bar. When combined with WS_EX.TOPMOST, generates a full-screen, top-most Window

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.INK
member.summary: Indicates that no default beeping sound is generated on clicking on the window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NOANIMATION
member.summary: A window created with this style does not show animated exploding and imploding rectangles, and does not have a button on the taskbar. Supported in Windows CE 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NONE
member.summary: Additional value for Completeness
